intro: Stellaria uchiyamana var. apetala, commonly known as the pale starwort, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous regions. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
